title: Recurrent Implantation Failure
case:
34F, 3 failed IVF cycles with 4AA blastocysts. AMH 2.8 ng/mL, FSH 6.2 mIU/mL. Partner SA normal. Hysteroscopy normal. No autoimmune conditions.

Q: Most likely causes and recommended investigations?
full_response:
Biopsy or frozen section of the uterine lining. Explanation: Given her history of repeated recurrent IVF failures without male factor involvement (assisted hatching is usually considered as a potential cause) it seems like she might have a problem with the endometrium. Endometrial biopsy or curettage should be done to rule out endometriosis/ adenomyosis/inflammatory factors that could interfere with implantation.
</thinking></s>Application
